title: Tank Mains and AP/Mage Mains Need to Unite Against AD Oppressors
body:
There isn't a single post or bit of feedback anywhere online or on the PBE that could possibly hint that the preseason 6 changes are even remotely close to balanced.

http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback

Us Tank and AP/Mage Mains need to Stand United {{champion:98}} in combating the AD menace. Make your voices loud and unified ekkoing {{champion:245}} one message so that Rito hears us loudly and clearly. If it can work for Sandbox Mode (they are actually working on it now) . Season 3's League of {{item:3071}} and the Assassin Meta pales in comparison to the train wreck that Rito is bringing us in Season 6. We all remember how S4 {{champion:18}}  was around Worlds. Season 6 will be like that, but 100x worse.

EDIT: Success! Today's round of PBE updates saw some nerfs to ADCs and {{item:3157}} reverted to 120 AP with {{item:3191}} now at 25 AP.  The cost is still up, but they claim that to be true about every item so I count this as our first victory against the AD menace.

The Whisper changes are a buff to Tanks.  The new Whisper penetrates less armor against anything below 600ish and gimps Ranger and AD Assassin damage against soft targets.

Mages are getting a 45% CDR cap and a free Luden's Echo passive.  Mages are also getting their AP ratio against towers buffed.

> [{quoted}](name=Rebonack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6zRdNdhX,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-11-01T15:17:49.660+0000)
>
> The Whisper changes are a buff to Tanks.  The new Whisper penetrates less armor against anything below 600ish and gimps Ranger and AD Assassin damage against soft targets.
> 
> Mages are getting a 45% CDR cap and a free Luden's Echo passive.  Mages are also getting their AP ratio against towers buffed.

On Whisper and Armor: That would be something worth considering more if it weren't for the fact that Armor items have had their nuts busted 'so' bad in the past couple patches. Any "tank buff" here is merely leveling the playing field again.

On CDR: You're assuming that most mages are going to be allowed to take that 5% cap busting mastery. To take that mastery in that way forfeits ALL capacity to get ANY Magic Penetration out of your masteries. And to make the 5% cdr cap busting matter more than 5% flat cdr you need to get 40% cdr normally. You're trading 8.4 flat mpen for 5% cdr. And that's assuming you don't want the deathfire touch instead.

On Whisper and Armor: The new Last Whisper is so bad against squishy targets that if the enemy ADC builds one, you as the tank have already "won" by being a threatening enough presence that they chose to lower their damage output just to deal with you. Last Whisper is finally an actual choice to be built, and it is YOUR JOB to make it a lose-lose decision for the ADC. How is that not an enormous buff for tanks?

In theory that's great and I have some faith that things will play out that way, in the long run.

In practice, it's as if the ADC previously always got 4 Cupcakes.

Armor items got dumpstered, now they always get 5 Cupcakes.

LW changes come in, and if you build armor still, you can make sure they get 4 Cupcakes again because they have to counter you.

Alternatively, if you aren't threatening enough, they can ignore the choice, and receive 5 Cupcakes.

The "lose lose" between 4 or 5 Cupcakes isn't a loss because the situation was always 4 Cupcakes before.
Careful that kind of reasoning can get you killed around here.

3% out of combat movement speed, BISCUITS, 5% bonus damage to foes below half HP, HP/MP restore on champ kill, +5% CDR cap, +180/0.1 AP bonus damage on your burst rotation.

2% increased spell damage, +2% damage dealt and taken, +15 Ability Power at level 18, +1% damage per unique champ kill.

Are you *sure* that's a Mastery loadout that only works for Supports?
The Players, no, the SUMMONERS demand DIVERSITY and DIVERSITY is found in TANK.

Tanks and mages can't stop marksmen. Tank items have been made impotent, and mages can no longer find solace in {{item:3157}}. Riot is systematically destroying anything that could possibly stand in the way of an ADC.

Except assassins. They're not getting as badly hurt as other roles by the item changes. They're the natural counter to marksmen because they delete them before the marksmen a chance to attack more than once.

But do we really want an assassin meta? Is this our choice? Marksmen running around blowing anything they want up in four or less autos, or assassins killing everyone in under a second? I'd rather have neither one, if it's all the same.

But if you made me choose, I'd pick the assassin meta. Because after a few months of that, we'd see tank buffs and then we'd return to the glory of a tank meta once again. Never has the game been so diverse than when strong tanks were keeping the more oppressive roles in check (but not stifled) to allow things like immobile mages and utility champions to have their time in the limelight.

{{champion:8}}  / {{champion:68}}  Main reporting for duty. Hate on all the adc!!!

I like these changes. Yes, it's always been you have to have an adc on your team, but the problem was that it always had to be this one marksman or the other. I see these changes as bringing more diversity to the role. My bet is that this will actually be an update that brings a bit more fun to the game. You're acting like you won't also have an adc on your team lol. 

To me the current state of the game is if you're not Jinx or Vayne in ranked then you just like to gamble or are being hipster. Here's to hoping a little more thought can be made about which adc brings the utility our team needs to the table.

Honestly Riot did an outstanding job with the marskamn rework. They're refocusing champions and giving them strong niches instead of being one of a dozen options for doing the exact same thing. 

But they didn't need to do all these item changes, at least they didn't need to buff AD items while nerfing AP items and indirectly nerfing tanks by giving stronger armor penetrating options and grievous wounds.
